name: Charles_Lindbergh
text:
Charles Lindbergh
Charles Lindbergh was an influential American figure in the 20th century.
In 1989, an archivist stated Meriwether Lewis' cultural impact to be equal to those of Lindbergh, John Glenn, and Neil Armstrong combined.
Behind the scenes
Charles Lindbergh (February 4, 1902 – August 26, 1974) was an American aviator most famous for making the first solo, non-stop transatlantic flight in 1927.
In 1932, Lindbergh's son, Charles Lindbergh Jr., was kidnapped and murdered. In "Episode 8," Dale Cooper wishes that he had been the one to solve this crime.
